entry.title: Show Compose nudge on focus without click.
entry.content:
The Chrome Compose feature uses the Autofill popup to show a nudge,

i.e., a UI surface that informs the user that they have saved state

for a certain textarea/contenteditable. However, the intended behavior

for the Compose nudge is slightly different from that of the normal

Autofill popup: While the normal Autofill popup is only supposed to

show if a focus event was triggered by a left click or a tap (at least

on Desktop), the Compose nudge is always supposed to be shown if the

element gains focus.



To achieve this, this CL adds a new trigger source for showing

Autofill suggestions (i.e. the popup) for events in which a textarea

is focused without a left click/tap. BrowserAutofillManager checks

the trigger source and only queries Compose for suggestions, but not

other sources (e.g. addresses) if the source is

kTextareaFocusedWithoutClick.



Bug: b/316010526

Change-Id: I496685356e656764c18bf7b3345d14699c8f27a7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5163887

entry.title: tote tour: Add feature param for reduced rate limiting
entry.content:
In order to facilitate testing, this adds a parameter to an existing

feature flag to allow for rate limiting to be tested in a reasonable

time frame.



When the flag is enabled without the new parameter or with the parameter

set to false, the nudge will always be shown when a qualifying file is

dragged over the wallpaper, which is consistent with its current

behavior.



When the flag is enabled with the new parameter enabled, the count

restriction of 3 times total will be enabled, and the rate restriction

will be enabled as 1 minute instead of 24 hours.



Bug: b:274659315

Change-Id: I91e55955d006edf6fc6b1bbba86125b1eeab8c67

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5181956

entry.title: Do not intercept for prefetch in subframes.
entry.content:
Other parts of the prefetch code assume this is for top-level

navigation. If we do want to support this, we'd have to do

adjust it to properly handle cookie and cache partitioning

in a more sophisticated way.



The corresponding test that uses iframes is updated; there is

already parallel coverage using window.open.

entry.title: Reland "Add a screen-ai CIPD package for PDF OCR E2E tests on Linux"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 8c005672e75f619a1f2df8241fe996f9f03cbe7d



Patch set 1 has the previously reviewed CL and in patchset 5, the failed

MSAN test is disabled and will be followed up in parallel.

The library is already in use in Chrome, so landing this test with

the disabled test does not make it worse.



Original change's description:

> Add a screen-ai CIPD package for PDF OCR E2E tests on Linux

>

> To have E2E tests for PDF OCR on Windows, macOS, and Linux, we need to

> be able to download and use the screen-ai library in those tests.

> Pursuing this goal, we upload the screen-ai library for Linux to CIPD

> and download it from CIPD to //third_party/screen-ai. This downloaded

> library is then loaded in E2E tests (i.e. browser tests).

>

> For more information, visit go/chrome_screen_ai_tests and read the

> Uploading the library files to CIPD section.

>

> AX-Relnotes: n/a.

entry.title: Refactor the AppRegistryCache::OnApps function.
entry.content:
This CL is used to prepare for CL:5138416, to fix the browser

tests: WebKioskTest.AlreadyInstalledOffline.



This CL is pure refactor and no function change.



There are two parts in AppRegistryCache::OnApps:

1. When should_notify_initialized is true, notify observers apps have

been intialized.

2. Publish/modify apps.



OnApps is called by both AppServiceProxy and AppStorage. When called

by AppStorage, the above 2 parts are called separately. So split

AppRegistryCache::OnApps into 2 functions, which is more clear:

1. InitApps(apps::AppType app_type)

To observers apps have been intialized.

2. OnApps(std::vector deltas)

Publish/modify apps.



Rename OnAppsInitialized to OnAppTypePublished, as that is used by

AppStorage only to know apps published by publishers, and it should be

called only when publishers publish apps.



BUG=1385932, b:307623506



Change-Id: Ie10210553631efd42837d75257975091681cc262

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5167089

Reviewed-by: Maggie Cai

Commit-Queue: Nancy Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1245122}

entry.title: Add PickerCategoryView to show Picker results for a specific category.
entry.content:
When users select a category, show a PickerCategoryView with initial

results (e.g. saved, recent, default suggestions) for that category.



For now, PickerCategoryView looks very similar to

PickerSearchResultsView, but this will later be updated with some more

specific category layouts.



Note that search results are still shown in PickerSearchResultView (we

just add another parameter when searching results to narrow down to the

selected category if needed).

entry.title: capture_mode: Set `camera_preview_view_` before its initialization
entry.content:
If initialization of `CameraPreviewView` is done its ctor before

the instance is set to `camera_preview_view_`, it may lead to an

event that triggers an operation requiring `camera_preview_view_`

causing a crash.



This CL splits construction from initialization.

entry.title: PinnedState: Support PinWindow API on Lacros
entry.content:
This CL moves window_pin_util.h to chrome/browser/ui/chromeos and

implements it in both ash and lacros.



Previously, lacros implementation was directly written in tab_api.cc

unlike ash, and made it difficult to test the feature in the same way as

the production code. Now PinWindow/UnpinWindow APIs are implemented for

both platforms, so developers can call it regardless of the test

platform.



This is required for re-enable lacros locked fullscreen tests.



This CL does not affect the behavior except for ash having additional

CHECK.

entry.title: Histograms for the time to display UI from kernel resumed
entry.content:
The Power.KernelResumeTimeOn* metrics only shows the elapsed time of

the resuming in the kernel but we also need to know the elapsed time

in the user space because user's resume experience is based on when

the UI is shown.



This adds DisplayAfterResumeDurationMsOn{AC,Battery} histograms

to report the elapsed time in user space when resuming from

Suspend-To-RAM mode.



This also un-expire the Power.KernelResumeTimeOnBattery which will

be used with DisplayAfterResumeDurationMsOnBattery.



Bug: b:256693104

entry.title: snap-groups: Remove `divider_position_` during transition
entry.content:
This removes the need for `divider_position_` during tablet <->

clamshell transition, before `split_view_divider_` is created. This

will allow us to move `divider_position_` to `SplitViewDivider`.



This also modifies `GetClosestFixedDividerPosition()` to take in

`divider_position` as an argument, since we may need it to get the

closest divider position before `divider_position_` as a member

variable is set.

entry.title: Reland "iwa: integrate Isolated Web Apps installer with ChromeOS Shelf"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit cfd4a70f1402883544909f8b2634a5de34a4fda9



The origin CL was reverted because

IsolatedWebAppInstallerShelfItemControllerTest.ExecuteClosingCommand

crashed on ASAN builds.



aura::Window destructor should detach all its observers. However, turns

out, observers attached using base::ScopedObservation do not get

detached.



This CL removes the use of base::ScopedObservation and directly attach

using `aura::Window::AddObserver` instead.

entry.title: [URL] Use CanonicalizeNonSpecialURL for non-special URLs
entry.content:
Use CanonicalizeNonSpecialURL for non-special URLs in canonicalizing

URLs.



The feature is currently guarded by the flag.



Virtual `url-non-special` web tests now have the new expectation files,

which are mechanically added by `blink_tool.py rebaseline-cl`.



While we can see a significant improvement in the passing rate on WPT

url tests, many tests still fail due to a lack of support for

non-special URLs in:



- url::Origin

- url::ReplaceComponents

- and many others



Subsequent CLs will address them.

entry.title: Check pressed/released events in event_rewriter_unittest.
entry.content:
The original code often checks only key pressed events.

Also, it uses modifier flag to emulate modifier keys are held during the

key events.



Current EventRewriterAsh gives it a try to support the rewriting of such

cases, but failed and so it causes bugs.

In order to fix the bugs, we have to track key press/release states

in EventRewriter. Actually, we do some already in EventRewriterAsh, but

not enough.

With the change, the current testing approach won't work, because

key status tracked in EventRewriter will disagree with the events sent

from test code.



This CL prepares to such a change by testing key press/release events

(defined as "type" in the code).

Also, on annotating modifier flags, key pressed events for the modifier

keys will be sent before the target key events, and also key released events

will be sent after the target key events to reset the EventRewriter's

internal status.



Also, EventRewriter can rewrite one event to multiple events conceptually,

while the current test checks only the first event.

This CL starts to verify all events dispatched from the rewriter for

the target events.



Note that several bugs are revealed by this change. They are commented

as TODO, since this is not a regression by test change.



BUG=1440147

TEST=Tryjob



Change-Id: Ic71d1911d42a00f5bd375576bf0c007c0b459c12

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5155008

Commit-Queue: Hidehiko Abe

Reviewed-by: David Padlipsky

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1245055}

entry.title: On macOS 14+, call gktool before running bundles.
entry.content:
gktool prewarms macOS 14's Gatekeeper cache. macOS 14 may run Gatekeeper

on any bundle it never scanned, not just bundles with the quarantine

attribute, so we need this extra step to avoid a user-visible popup.



Bug: 1510576

Change-Id: Ia808a57fcea1eb1ab235b03e078672ea0b77ac6f

entry.title: Fix saving embedded images from pages resulting from form POST.
entry.content:
This requires being able to distinguish between when the image we're

saving is the result of a form POST (being rendered as an image

document), and when it's an image embedded in an HTML page (and was

itself fetched via a normal GET).



To this end, the context menu data now includes whether this is a

document which exists only to host a single image, media or plugin

element. This allows the browser to distinguish whether it's a

subresource that's being interacted with, pass that into WebContents,

and not attempt to use the post data if it is.



Fixed: 1285983

entry.title: Scope SearchResultImageViewDelegate to image list
entry.content:
Instead of using a global SearchResultImageViewDelegate instance in

SearchResultImageViews, scope the delegate to an

SearchResultImageListView, and pass it to SearchResultImageViews in

their constructors. Using a global SearchResultImageViewDelegate had an

invalid assumption that at most one instance could exist at the time -

this did not take into account that both bubble and tablet mode launcher

have their own SearchResultImageListView, and thus their own

SearchResultImageViewDelegate.

entry.title: [ash] Improve login and session restore metrics.
entry.content:
chrome:SessionRestore and ash::FullRestore are independent sources of

restore data. Because of the way session restore works, the data loading

events may come in many different ways. Thic Cl adds separate data

tracking in LoginUnlockThroughputRecorder for both sources to make the

metrics reporting more robust.

entry.title: Sharesheet: Ensure delivered_callback is non-null
entry.content:
It's confusing to have delivered_callback be sometimes null, since all

sites need to nullcheck the callback before using it. Instead, we

can ensure the callback is always non-null in ShowBubble, and then use

the callback without further checks.



This addresses a crash due to running a null callback inside

SharesheetService::OnAppIconsLoaded.



Bug: 1274438

entry.title: Move FindToolbarTablet out from the toolbar_container
entry.content:
Find in page popup on tablets can be included as part of the top toolbar capture sometimes, if capture happened before the hide animation finishes. This breaks the assumption that the toolbar is always at the bottom in the resource capture.



This CL moves the find_toolbar_tablet_stub out from the toolbar_container so it'll not be included in the capture, while staying at the same place due to the fact ToolbarControlContainer is a FrameLayout.

entry.title: media: Add `MediaLogToConsole` feature
entry.content:
Currently MediaLog shows up in log concole in debug build by default.

See https://crrev.com/c/4686823. This is convenient for media/

developers, but could be spammy for developers not working nor

interested in media/.



This CL adds a new `kMediaLogToConsole` feature to control this

behavior. It is enabled by default on Android and ChromeOS builds

where remote debugging is common. On other platforms, media/

developers can easily enable it on command line.



Bug: 1331597

Test: Manually tested on Linux

entry.title: WebNN: Fix gather operator creation failure for scalar indices
entry.content:
This failure happens when the indices tensor is a 0-D scalar. A one

value should be inserted at the `axis` position of the output

dimensions, because the dimensions of a scalar is set to {1} on the

DirectML backend.



This CL also adds more test cases for 0-D indices and skips the tests

if feature level < 3.0.

entry.title: [reland] ash: refactor LoginWebDialog
entry.content:
This change:

* Removes most of LoginWebDialog's overrides of methods on

WebDialogDelegate, replacing them with uses of the new setter and

callback methods;

* Removes the manual self-delete in LoginWebDialog::OnDialogClosed() in

favor of the base WebDialogDelegate's lifetime management;

* Removes CertificateManagerDialog (the only subclass of LoginWebDialog)

entirely, in favor of configuring an instance of LoginWebDialog.

entry.title: OP: Add NotificationCenterController base
entry.content:
Have NotificationCenterBubble own a unique_ptr to a controller

that manages the NotificationCenter and updates its view.



This controller tracks `NotificationCenterView`, and in the next CLs

will be updated to be the main MessageCenter observer class to detect

changes and provide to the appropriate `NotificationListView`s.



Needed for the OngoingProcesses project since there will be two

list views, and the controller logic will be extracted out of the

views so pinned + unpinned lists can be handled differently.



go/ongoing-processes-dd

entry.title: TaskAttribution: Remove TaskAttributionInfo prefinalizer
entry.content:
TaskAttributionInfo disposal tracking is needed to reset the soft nav

heuristics when all descendant tasks of potential soft nav tasks have

completed. Instead of using a prefinalizer for this, we can observe the

set of root tasks becoming empty using a custom weakness callback, like

so:

1. Change the set to HeapHashSet>

2. Trace() the set. This will register a weak container callback, which

will clear weak members of the set.

3. After tracing the set, if the set is non-empty, add a custom

weakness callback. This will run after the weak container callback,

and it can check if the set became empty.



This enables removing the prefinalizer, which will also enable moving to

a per-isolate TaskAttributionTracker without needing to store the

tracker or isolate in the TaskAttributionInfo.



Bug: 1351643

entry.title: save descriptors to history and show them in aria-label
entry.content:
The goal here is to save the subject, style, and mood descriptors

associated with a generated wallpaper so that when it is shows in the

user's history it can have a meaningful aria-label instead of just an

index number.



* Add subject, style, and mood to prefs information for history entries

* When we get the list of history entries, extract the descriptors from

prefs and put it in the |HistoryEntry| object along with the id. This

will then be changed shape for passing to the UI by creating a

ResultDescriptors object to be in the result.

* All descriptors are optional to account for current history entries,

which have no data.

* When a result is set as the theme, pass the descriptors to the handler

so that they can be stored for later if the theme ends up being saved

to history.

* When a history entry is set as the theme, pass the descriptors to the

handler so that they can be stores for later if the theme ends up

being saved to history again (this time at the front). This is done

instead of looking up the descriptors in the prefs for simplicity.

This way no lookup has to be done, since we already have access to the

data.



Screencast showing aria-labels through dev tools:

https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTk4MjY4NzA2MjkxNzEyMHwxYWE3NjVlNS00MQ



Extras:

* String for the aria-label for results was updated to match the

greenlines better.
